issue.title: Segway process uses too much memory

content.raw:
`--num-instances` seems to be tied to this issue. 

Very little memory is "leaked" if at all for `--num-instances 2` (still multithreaded). 
However when `--num-instances` when set to 10, significant memory seems to "leak" by the megabyte within a minute.

This results were consistent with Segway currently (tip) and the Segway 1.2.0 release.

I cannot run an earlier release of Segway since the cluster system is not recognized.
